questions.question: What is the chemical formula of the novel Cd(II)–organic framework synthesized?
What is the activation energy for proton transfer in the composite Cd-MOF@CNT/Naﬁon membrane compared to the pristine Cd-MOF/Naﬁon?
questions.answer: Lower in the composite Cd-MOF@CNT/Naﬁon membrane

questions.question: True or False: The Cd-MOF@CNTs/GCE can be used for the electrocatalytic oxidation of glucose only.
What is the limit of detection (LOD) for glucose using Cd-MOF/GCE?
Does the Cd-MOF@CNTs/GCE exhibit a pronounced reduction peak for hydrogen peroxide reduction?
True or False: The pristine Cd-MOF exhibits temperature-insensitive proton conduction.
What is the linear range for glucose detection using Cd-MOF@CNTs/GCE?
Can Cd-MOF@CNTs detect glucose and H2O2 efficiently in real-world samples?
True or False: The Cd-MOF@CNTs/GCE has a lower limit of detection for glucose compared to the pristine Cd-MOF/GCE.
What is the limit of detection (LOD) for hydrogen peroxide using Cd-MOF@CNTs/GCE?
True or False: The Cd-MOF@CNTs/GCE exhibits more sensitive and selective oxidative sensing for glucose compared to the pristine Cd-MOF/GCE.
What is the yield of the novel Cd(II)–organic framework synthesis?
True or False: The Cd-MOF@CNTs/GCE can be used for the electrocatalytic reduction of H2O2 only.
What is the role of carbon nanotubes (CNTs) in the composite Cd-MOF@CNTs?
questions.answer: To improve the electrochemical sensing performance of the Cd-MOF

questions.question: True or False: The Cd-MOF@CNTs/GCE has a wider detection range for glucose compared to the pristine Cd-MOF/GCE.
What is the activation energy for proton transfer in the pristine Cd-MOF/Naﬁon membrane?
questions.answer: Higher than in the composite Cd-MOF@CNT/Naﬁon membrane

questions.question: True or False: The Cd-MOF@CNTs/GCE shows a pair of irreversible redox peaks suitable for glucose oxidation and hydrogen peroxide reduction.
What is the role of the Cd-MOF in the composite Cd-MOF@CNTs?
questions.answer: To enhance the proton conductivity and exhibit electrocatalytic behavior for glucose oxidation and hydrogen peroxide reduction

questions.question: True or False: The Cd-MOF@CNTs/GCE can detect glucose and H2O2 in real-world samples with high sensitivity and selectivity.
What is the structural feature of the Cd-MOF that contributes to its proton conduction?
questions.answer: A 2D topological framework extending into a two-fold interpenetrated 3D supramolecular network via hydrogen bonding
